column4: in ubunto how do i tell the version of gcc installed I did an echo $CC and dont get anything?
I installed the gcc packages but it tells me  gcc: command not found do i have to configure gcc some how or specify an environment variable?
try gcc-4.0
I mean try typing "gcc-4.0" instead of "gcc"
there's supposed to be a symlink from /usr/bin/gcc to gcc-4.0 - but sometimes it doesn't get made.  ubuntu's a bit flaky sometimes
so i should ln -s /usr/bin/gcc-4.0 /usr/bin/gcc after creating directory gcc ?
sudo ln -s gcc-4.0 /usr/bin/gcc is how it usually looks
you're missing the symbolic link from /usr/bin/gcc to gcc-4.0?
what happens if you just run "gcc" on its own?
ls -l /usr/bin/gcc.  what about that?
ls -l /usr/bin/gcc.  what about that?
was that addressed to me?
yes sorry
that can't possibly be the output of the command I asked you to run
could you try again, but copy/paste this time?
ls -l /usr/bin/gcc
so /usr/bin/gcc is a directory?
you need to do this:  "sudo bash -c '/bin/rm -r /usr/bin/gcc; ln -s gcc-4.0 /usr/bin/gcc'"
to see that it's really a directory, do this: "ls -ld /usr/bin/gcc"
see the initial 'd'?  that means it's a directory
I've got my suspicions :)
I reckon it was a combination of you, sudo and mkdir :)
